answerText: laser cooling (accept anything that mentions going to low temperatures)[10] One form of laser cooling uses a "slower" named for this physicist. This physicist also names an effect which transitions to the PaschenBack effect at high magnetic fields.

question: Question:  [10] Chu, Cohen-Tannoudji, and Phillips won the Nobel for using lasers to do this to isolated atoms. This process is necessary to form superconductors because above a critical point, thermal interactions bridge the band gap for system and the system stops being a condensate.
